Review:
it‚Äôs an all-you-can-eat buffet, with a fusion-style menu. brunch started out great, dishes were tasty and morale was high. but our experience quickly deteriorated when we started getting mediocre and subpar dishes. the service got slower, some utensils we got were dirty, coffee tasted old, and the desserts weren‚Äôt thoroughly cooked

collectively we probably tried a little less than half the menu. the best thing (which was just decent) were the curry chicken empanadas if for some reason you end up here

wouldn‚Äôt come back to eat here but decent vibes in the surrounding area with other restaurants

we ordered delivery and the pizzas were ofc fresh. the crust was soft (as opposed to being charred and/or having structure) - it kind of reminded me of middle school cafeteria pizza. they have specialty flavors like chicken parm. pizzas were alright, but too flimsy and too heavy for me
classy cocktails and aesthetic (but small) space. it‚Äôs also in upper east so it‚Äôs prob a little out of the way

excellent ambiance and good thai food. the panang curry was a little oily but was good. would highly recommend the si-sa-ket. the thai tea lava cake was unique and amazing - easily the best lava cake i‚Äôve had
good wings and nice specialty sauces
pretty decent food, specifically the brunch. but i‚Äôve been here several times for happy hour and it‚Äôs great. seating might be hard to find but the vibes are worth
good service but the food was pretty subpar. this is one of those places where they have too many dishes in the menu and prob don‚Äôt do a great job on any of them

Place: Chicago's Pizza With A Twist (Ashburn, VA)
Review: known for their indian style pizzas. i‚Äôve gotten takeout a few times and always felt like they put too much ginger but great pizzas nonetheless, would recommend

curries are pretty solid (paneer makhani specifically), biryani is decent, naan is alright. nothing mind blowing and ambiance wasn‚Äôt very great but food and service were good so it gets a 4. handful of takeout orders while we dined in which is always a good sign

really friendly service here and the food is good - decent kabobs and soft bread. location is not super great, in a pretty low key part of town with not much else to do/eat. but good place for some clean greek food
used to be my fav indian place in nova but its quality went down pretty drastically imo. been here several times for both buffet and dinner. vibe is classy but food is just ok (not bad)

get the za‚Äôatar hot sandwich with veggie chorizo and thank me later. it has some really good custom aioli. also had the roasted veggie cream cheese with a bagel and it was delicious (nothing unique but v tasty). this would be a 5 but the bagel was slightly hard
all the pizzas were delicious but i liked the classic and tie dye the most. the apps are fine but nothing special

i came here again and i‚Äôll stand by my claim - this is the best spot for south indian food in nova

i got the paneer masala dosa this time - it‚Äôs just the same masala flavor but with paneer instead of potatoes (see pics). comes with sambar, podi, and chutneys. also had the chicken 65 which was so fresh and the chicken biryani which was decent (more of a pulao but it‚Äôll do). service was a bit better than last, maybe it‚Äôs bc they remembered us

again, the place is pretty ratchet but we were there for less than an hour and saw several people eating at the place and picking up food to go - always a great sign

this is cereal flavored ice cream. i was expecting milkbar kind vibes which uses cereal milk to make their ice cream. this place just uses vanilla and grinds your choice of cereal into it - i had cinnamon toast crunch. this grinding method won‚Äôt fully/seamlessly incorporate the cereal flavor like milkbar does but i kind of liked it that way, added a crunch - see attached pic for ref

this is realistically a 4.5 but i‚Äôll give it a 5, i was pleasantly surprised

slightly overhyped but decent late night food. it‚Äôs not bad but i agree with priya, chicken was a bit dry. everyone knows halal guys has insanely spicy red sauce, my preference is one strip red and four strips white
excellent late night food
good food and beautiful location, though a bit overpriced
don‚Äôt get anything other than biryani here - and maybe some apps

aside from the unnecessarily loud music, this place has clean vibes for a small group - and it‚Äôs close to rtc so bonus points for that. but the food was pretty mediocre. the panang curry fell a tad bit flat in flavor and the rice was dry. thai iced tea was ok, nothing special. looked like they had a decent drink selection but my friends weren‚Äôt huge fans
sandwiches are slightly dry (there‚Äôs a piece of bread in the middle). kabob is good. service is good. will be back
curry chicken was mid for flavor but breading was good. they cook it in like a normal pot, not a nindustrial deep fryer
they were fine but were a little greasy. i like hot lola‚Äôs better
ramen was way too salty and veggie sushi tasted rubbery. service was so friendly and fast though. this is rated p well on google so maybe worth trying other dishes

bomb dj, would come back just for him. food was decent, fried chicken sandwich was marinated in green chutney

ps don‚Äôt call the waiter ‚Äúsir‚Äù @tejas @ani üëÄ

another 3.5 - this is a 4 for the pizza dough/crust but a 3 ish for cheese and sauce (i think the sauce wasn‚Äôt cooked/reduced and it didn‚Äôt play that well with the thicker pizzas imo). but i generally liked the philly style (with sun dried tomatoes) and classic margarita
this is basically just an &pizza (which i generally like). good food and nice location, too

i had the blueberry and coconut muesli which wasn‚Äôt bad per se but it wasn‚Äôt really good either, esp for the price point. honestly this is more of a 2.5 for me - can‚Äôt really recommend this place

classic mexican chain spot. my go to dish is the chicken fajitas and i always walk out stuffed. service isn‚Äôt anything great and usually there‚Äôs a wait for dinner (esp on weekends) but good vibes and nice location
pretty sure they missed adding the thai part of my drink, tasted like an ordinary cold brew latte
decent, slightly cozy vibes. coffee isn‚Äôt anything special and agree with ani, food is subpar

yet another amazing experience at my favorite kabob place. i usually get the chicken kabob but decided to try the shawarma this time - and it unsurprisingly also slapped. you definitely get a bit more meat, too. i‚Äôm prob going to be alternating between the kabob and the shawarma each time i come back

service was superb as per usual. we were the very last customers that night. we ordered for pick up and i thanked them for fulfilling our last min order and told them how we always come out of our way for them because we love their food. and they ended up offering us free drinks on our way out üôÇ

this is a pretty subpar wood fire oven pizza place, not sure why it's so highly rated on google. maybe we just got unlucky

the pizza crust was soggy and the flavors were pretty medicore. i can make better pizza than this (i have an ooni). the mozz bread appetizer was surprisingly pretty tasty for how bland it looked, honestly liked it more than the pizza üò¨

vibes of the place were subpar, too. it's literally next to a gas station and parking is so tight. better off going to some place in clarendon proper
modern pub-style spot. thai popcorn chicken was good and their fries were excellent, everything else was alright. they have a huge, rotating selection of drinks
this place used to be solid but its quality has gone down. if you decide to go here, go for the lunch buffet. decent variety of food but nothing really special or great

admittedly i have lots of nostalgia for this place (one of my go to spots at uva) but they do have the best fried dumplings i‚Äôve had. i always get chicken, tofu is a bit bland. fried rice (with sriracha) and cold peanut noodles are a must
chicken was a little dry, otherwise nothing special. good location tho, it‚Äôs right on the marina
solid detroit style pizza. greektown was surprisingly good, pass on the veggie since it was too soggy
wish i wasn‚Äôt so full when we got this, szechuan Ôøºchicken was good
the bruschetta was surprisingly good, low key would go back for just that. super friendly service, too
just another solid indian restaurant in the area. i had leftovers (specifically the malai kofta) and it was good. will probably visit in person at some point
both aesthetic and delicious desserts

decent ice cream spot, they make the ice cream fresh in stand mixers with liquid nitrogen and cream. i got the affogato with vanilla bean and it was fine, though a bit sweet. i personally still prefer pitango for the subtleness of its flavors
this used to be a go-to for ramen but i think their quality is dropping
slightly harsh but didn‚Äôt enjoy it as much as i thought i would. note that i was also insanely full so prob still worth a try
complementary chips and hummus were solid. the gyro was surprisingly solid, would recommend trying the souvlaki but i had a bite of my friend‚Äôs shawarma and it was good, too (though a bit salty)

came here after going to the driving range about a mile away. this is in a super wack, run down strip mall kind location but was rated really well on google so we went. when we got there, the wait was 30 mins but the people in front of us said it was worth it so we stuck around - glad we did. it‚Äôs comfort food and it was generally pretty good. pancakes, eggs, and turkey sausage were solid. hash browns were ok but the grits weren‚Äôt great. staff was friendly and food came out really quick. would come back
it‚Äôs a bit overrated. the food was good but nothing to write home about. go here mainly for the experience, not the food

came here after a day on the slopes (whitetail), highly recommend. the pizzas were delicious (i really liked the pickle pizza bc it was unique) and they have a good beer and cocktail selection, too. and the interior has a nice, modern vibe

unfortunate that the place is temporarily closed for a revamp but this is my fav indian place in nova right now. really classy vibes, tasty food (though small portions). expect to spend a bit but it‚Äôs well worth it. would recommend the butter chicken. my friends got the biryani and chole and said it was solid. cocktail selection is nice, too

yet another indian restaurant in the area that used to be so good (used to be a go to, even catered from here), but went down in quality. last i went, the curries felt watered down and agree w skanda - a bit flat in flavor. maybe worth going again to see if anything‚Äôs changed but it‚Äôs a 3 right now

another excellent experience at a tyson‚Äôs staple. summer nights on the plaza here with good company ü§åüèΩ

i got the honey chicken sliders and they were delicious (though we played volleyball for 2 hours so i was pretty hungry). the buns were toasted and sweet. ask for the (homemade?) hot sauce on the side so it‚Äôs not too messy

everything is contactless - you just order on your phone and they bring everything out. service was both friendly and quick

we came here just for desserts since we saw the gelato was homemade. fair warning, it had the consistency of ice cream but i was pleasantly surprised by its flavor. it was so subtle and not too sweet, exactly what i prefer. would def recommend the lava cake. the service was v friendly and they were kind enough to give us bread. i want to come back to try the entrees at some point

finally made it here. pastries were mediocre (arguably subpar bc i don‚Äôt like super sweet things). but this is a 4 simply for the vibes and the hours. plus, late night summer walks in the parking lot next door with your friends ü§åüèΩ

i‚Äôll come back during the day at some point

i was a bit too harsh in my previous review. this is a 5, specifically for the chicken pad thai and the tofu. the pad thai is flavorful - it‚Äôs a little sweet but it pairs well with the spiciness. tofu dishes are pretty solid, i‚Äôm guessing they fry the tofu since they‚Äôre crispy on the outside with some structure and squish on the inside

ambiance is great and drink selection, esp during summer, is cool (though they didn‚Äôt have their usual selection last time i went)

some of the ideas behind taste were conceived at the bar here
large portions and tasty food. the staff was really friendly, too. we got takeout and ate at the beach

i had really high expectations going in because their menu looked delicious. but i hate to say that i have to just give it a 4, still a must try though

for a place that should be known for their chicken, it was actually a bit bland. the milk gravy was also lacking flavor

but their waffles were phenomenal. and their chicken tortilla soup is probably the best i‚Äôve had - i would go back just for this. service was beyond great - i called them to see if they‚Äôd seat us if we showed up 10 mins to close and they said of course. and he recognized us when we walked in and ensured we had a solid experience since it was our first visit

warning: they don‚Äôt serve dosas on sunday, i learned the hard way

been here a few times and agree with @shrinath, apps are bomb. but entrees are mid. i got the szechuan fried rice - it‚Äôs just the asian chili sauce you get at the grocery store (had leftovers with homemade raita and it was way better). chole bhature was decent. i‚Äôm generally a fan of pav bhaji but not here, flavors too strong and it never sits well

want to come back for the chinese noodle dosa though, that‚Äôs solid
my go-to is the model un with grilled chicken and tater tots (and usually the wahoo). great burger place on the corner and lots of memories here. service is fast and friendly, and vibes are great

can‚Äôt believe i‚Äôm downgrading this from a 5 to (really) a 3.5 - just didn‚Äôt slap as it did the first few times. still need to get the egg and spice level of 4 was just right

but just wasn‚Äôt as good as it used to be, maybe i was just too full going in this time around. i‚Äôll give it another try soon
great location (right next to union square) and great indoor vibes. dessert was really sweet for my taste but i‚Äôm sure others would enjoy it

valencia has delicious empanadas. i got the chicken tamarillo, black bean and cheese, and the curried cauliflower + ricotta. the curried cauliflower really stood out - it was so savory and flavorful. ask for the green and red sauces on the side - the empanadas can be thick on the edges (seems like they‚Äôre all handmade) so it was good to dip them

friends got other dishes and they were just ok

our server was nice but the food + drinks came out so slowly and the aesthetic of the place isn‚Äôt anything special. but my friend who‚Äôs local said this is one of his go-to spots

guilty pleasure, only really come here for the salad and breadsticks. pasta is subpar - it‚Äôs always over cooked and the sauce is too watery. excellent service though, our waiter kept bringing us salad and breadsticks without even asking

this is one of my favorite indian restaurants

what stands out most is the phenomenal service and classy atmosphere. the waiters spared no time refilling my water, they cleaned our table after every course, and helped pack our leftovers. i wouldn‚Äôt call this place fine dining per se but it‚Äôs pretty close - the waiters were simply very friendly and attentive. the owner also always hangs out at the door to greet everyone hello and say goodbye

ofc food was great. one dish stood out the most: the tandoori paneer app, so soft and tasty. papri chaat was also so good. for entrees, they have some unique naans - i had the chilly garlic, rosemary, and goat cheese. the naans aren‚Äôt buttery but they were still tasty, though i probably wouldn‚Äôt get the goat cheese again since it seemed a bit out of place. note that the entrees are a bit small in portion size. ended w some masala chai (bit milky but still good)

overall, great place. whenever we‚Äôre out in the area, we usually stop by here and leave very satisfied

lives up to the hype @priyanka. down a star bc curries were slightly oily. gobi manchurian is a must. biryani was also fire

this is really a 4.5
top tier fried chicken sandwiches, plus ballston quarter is a vibe

i‚Äôm not a huge hibachi guy so take this taste with a grain of salt. this is just okay hibachi. the vibes are clean but the chicken was just lacking some flavor. rice was good, just a tad oily but not too excessive. i wasn‚Äôt a fan of the salad since the ginger dressing was way too strong

i‚Äôve been to a ton of indian places in nova and this is up there. prob the best paneer makhani/butter chicken gravy in the area. pass on the mirchi paneer, wasn‚Äôt too flavorful (or spicy for that matter)

i‚Äôve been meaning to try this place for literally years but never went. so glad i did - they have delicious, fresh crepes. bonus points bc i heard the person making the crepes talk in french to someone

been here a handful of times and came back for the first time in a while. the quality went down a bit, evident by the weird dry + silky coating (didn‚Äôt feel fresh). the sweet potato tempura was solid, had a nice crunch. the desserts were surprisingly decent - both the green tea cheesecake and the seasonal one (think it was raspberry + mango)

this is really a 3.5 but the dumplings, which used to be good, brought it down
great boba, i got the black tea and it was subtlety sweet

this is a vegetarian hot dog stand and the dogs are awesome. would recommend the depwich, it‚Äôs packed with flavor. came right when it opened, had to wait 15 mins but well worth (you can walk around the area and grab a snack/coffee). friendly staff, too
preferred the fettuccine but both pastas were solid. if i come back, i want to try the pizza (they looked delicious). this is a pretty popular place, would recommend booking a resy if you want to go

i got the pad thai and it was much sweeter than i would have liked. the thai tea was pretty solid, also a bit on the sweeter side. chicken meatballs were subpar, they def weren‚Äôt fresh. my friend claims that this is one of the best thai spots in the area and recommends the red curry - so i‚Äôll probably be back to try that. but for now, this place is a 3
decent dumplings, i liked basil chicken the best (and usually i don‚Äôt like basil). lemongrass and kale dumplings were a little too overpowering

i‚Äôve been here a few times (both buffet and dinner). this used to be a solid vegetarian place but the quality went down, esp the service. food isn‚Äôt bad but not really something i‚Äôd go to again given there are better options in close proximity
cauliflower empanada was really solid, tacos were pretty good, too. this is my go to spot for tacos

i‚Äôve been to few of joe‚Äôs pizza spots. classic, ‚Äúcheap‚Äù, ny-style pizza. flavors are good and the pizza is greasy. don‚Äôt forget to add red pepper flakes and garlic powder. note they only take cash
roasted cauliflower empanada is the best thing on the menu, i dream about this sometimes
food was pretty subpar - but the dessert was delicious and aesthetic

solid chicken sandwiches, up there with hot lola for me. but it was really messy and i would have liked coleslaw in the sandwich. but they give two fillets in each sandwich which is nice. hot isn‚Äôt too spicy but has a good kick
okay indian food and it‚Äôs in a good location (one loudoun). don‚Äôt get the tandoori chicken here, it‚Äôs not the deep red chicken you‚Äôd usually expect. curries and naan are decent

as you probably know, this is supposed to be one of the best pizza spots in the city. i can confirm - when you think about the ideal ny style pizza, this is what you imagine. simple, fresh, clean ingredients, friendly staff, and cozy aesthetic. still rating it a 5 even after the owner shafted us for our wine selection
rasmalai cake is their most popular dessert and it‚Äôs pretty solid. it‚Äôs one of those indian cakes so it‚Äôs light and melts in your mouth

after the abomination of indian food last night, we decided to head here and i‚Äôm glad we did. this is a rajistani indian restaurant

the garlic naan was fresh, puffy, and delicious. the paneer makhani was good, too - it was a bit on the sweeter end and the cardamom flavor was strong but i still enjoyed it. dal makhani was decent. i would recommend getting the kachumber salad, it was refreshing esp given the hot day. pass on the samosas, nothing exciting there
there are better places to get mexican food

pretty okay indian spot, it‚Äôs really a 3.5. they have a buffet for lunch. this place used to slap but has gone down in quality (which place hasn‚Äôt?)

they have (seemingly) mcd chicken nuggets as part of the buffet lol
good ramen but it was really spicy
first time having a banh mi - it was alright. but i‚Äôm also not a huge fan of vietnamese flavors so prob still worth trying if you are
definition of mid, maybe even sub mid - idk why it‚Äôs rated so well on google

this place was a hike but overall pretty solid indian food, most of the dishes were great. samosa chaat and tandoori chicken wings were solid. malai kofta was good and not too heavy, mutter paneer was good, chicken tikka masala was okay - pretty sure they all had the same gravy though. naans were kind of small. don‚Äôt get the biryani - way too much saffron that killed the dish. staff was fine but they were vacuuming while we were still eating which was wack. overall great food

singapore noodles were a little too salty. pad thai was alright but nothing special. it‚Äôs difficult to get a reservation here and even takeout had limited pick up times - wasn‚Äôt really worth it imo

i‚Äôm not a coffee shop aficionado but this place was superb. i got the mocha and it was excellent, not too sweet and good ratio of coffee/chocolate

what took this place to a 5 though was the vibey european-style aesthetic and the delicious pistachio muffin pastry (the one on the left in the pic). other snacks were great, too, but this one really stood out. unsurprisingly, the place was pretty busy with (seemingly) locals

everything here is farm to table, pizza was excellent. they apparently have the best mai tai‚Äôs around and i can attest. the fries and wings were alright (wings were a bit dry). the vibes are excellent. overall would recommend if you‚Äôre in the area
would highly recommend splitting a bunch of apps family style. the chicken samosas were shaped like empanadas but were awesome and the arnabeet was good (roasted cauliflower)
udon dish was way too salty. this place seems to always have a line - if you do go, would recommend ordering takeout and eating on the beach
it was fine but there are other places in the area that are worth checking out over this place

this place has a pretty subpar aesthetic and the rice dishes i‚Äôve had weren‚Äôt great. but it has the most amazing paneer (or chicken) wraps - so cheesy and so good. it‚Äôs one of my friend‚Äôs go-to spots and i can see why
we really enjoyed the aesthetic of the place - really clean and modern. the food was nothing great though. would not recommend the chicken shawarma wrap but the chicken parm pesto panini was alright
i don‚Äôt usually like shaved ice but this was good, flavors didn‚Äôt taste completely artificial
really solid pizza, especially like the crust. overall pretty good but didn‚Äôt blow me out of water as i would expect from a pretty hyped pizza place. would go again though
i don‚Äôt even like bananas but this pie was good. it was light and fluffy and not too sweet

solid, fresh, stone-baked pizza. i usually get half holy shiitake and half something chicken. the area this is in is pretty nice, too - relatively new. there are a few places to grab drinks and chill outside which is great when it‚Äôs warmer

but i‚Äôll come back every time. i get the tray w chicken strips, quesadilla, and yolo the other side. then i remove the sides from the box, cut up the strips into bite size chunks, add cookout sauce and bbq sauce in it, and shake the tray. this is the way to eat cook out

i learned that hojicha is just a euphemism for burnt matcha. just get matcha

the snacks looked good though but i didn‚Äôt have any
good, quick pan pizza. do takeout

solid mexican food, pleasantly surprised by the boom boom sauce (thanks for the rec @shrinath) - just the right amount of kick and very flavorful. chuy‚Äôs is better than uncle julio‚Äôs wrt food. get the chicken fajitas burrito (w the boom boom sauce) and the tres leches cake

made a resy for the back room and was super pleased. classy vibes, great service, and excellent drinks and food. they‚Äôre known for food-inspired cocktails and i was really happy with the waldorf salad (nice and refreshing) and the french toast (not too sweet like a lot of dessert-style drinks). i‚Äôd recommend the hot honey chicken sandwich, too
hand for size reference, hit the spot
sad, used to be fire if my memory serves me right

pretty decent indian place and it‚Äôs in one loudoun so bonus points for the vibes. naan and classic paneer/chicken curries are good, biryani is alright. would not recommend the tandoori chicken though
easily some of the best grilled cheese sandwiches i‚Äôve had. they have lots of varieties (so it‚Äôs not just a bunch of cheese). the sandwiches are a bit greasy but well worth imo

originally rated this a 4 but promoting it to a 5. came here to celebrate mom‚Äôs birthday and coincidentally cinco de mayo so it was packed and we had to wait a bit (they didn‚Äôt take resys, not sure if that was just for today or in general)

but the food was awesome. insanely large portions and so flavorful. this is def a mexican place with an indian twist, not a mix of the two cuisines equally. masala burrito was dank, butter chicken remix was solid, and cauliflower tacos were good (the cauliflower had the same flavor as gobi manchurian). would also recommend the pi√±a colada. taquitos were subpar though

solid service and nice, clean vibes. great place for small groups
it was a little salty

this is a funky bar that happens to only have vegan food. i had low expectations but my friend loves this place and convinced me to try it - and it was actually pretty good. i had the fried parm which was solid but i‚Äôd come back to try some of their other dishes. i‚Äôm not very into beer but they have an ok drink selection
half soy garlic and half spicy STRIPS is the move, with coleslaw and white rice on the side. i love bonchon. they had a new flavor recently that is a hard pass, tasted like dish soap
came here again and the honey + cardamom iced latte was delicious. good music and very friendly service, too

i‚Äôve been to a ton of indian places and this was def the most unique. the apps were really good and of the main dishes i tried, i liked the pressure cooker pulao the most. i‚Äôd pass on the nri drink
maybe a 3.5 depending on how much you like south indian food. different thalis for different days of the week. unlimited refills of curries/roti/rice
excellent food and excellent service. took a small detour from kailua to come here but it was well worth it
veggie lasagna was a little oily but good, ask for it w the vodka sauce. the bread was so fresh and delicious. desserts were heavy

i need to stop taking recommendations from @vijay. pretty mediocre, arguably subpar spot (except for sushi). everything is vegetarian, a lot is vegan

the chicken nuggets were alright if you don‚Äôt think of them as chicken nuggets (texture was weird, kinda squishy). my tofu dish was eh, i wouldn‚Äôt get it again - no texture

but even though i‚Äôm rating this a 3, i will say the fantasy roll was so so good - it‚Äôs a vegetarian california roll. i‚Äôd come back just for that and if i only had that, it‚Äôd be a 5

this is a classic example of ‚Äúdon‚Äôt judge a book by its cover‚Äù - if you‚Äôre in the mood for authentic south indian food in nova, this is it. the dosas were twice the size of my face, sambar was thick and flavorful, and the chutney was simple (as it arguably should be) but with the podi it was dank (wish they used ghee though, not oil). cut mirchi was too spicy for me but nice and crispy. chicken biryani was decent

location is pretty trash and the inside is kind of run down. service isn‚Äôt great either. but this place really shines for its food

i really liked the chana chawal here. the pav bhaji was okay, it was a little too buttery for me. the samosa was decent. and the pani puri was mediocre, the pani was more sweet than it was spicy so depends on what you‚Äôre into. solid spot though to stop at
new sundae flavor, dirt
i had the pollo asado burrito and it was really good and pretty filling. i had a bite of ani‚Äôs tofu and cauliflower burrito and honestly thought it was better. would come back for sure

i don‚Äôt like sushi (or seafood for that matter) but i finally made it here off the recommendations of a few friends since nami nori has a vegan set: it was pretty solid. the avocado roast and cucumber black sesame were amazing (first and last), others were either just good or mediocre. my friend got the signature set and loved it. we also got the nori chips (reminded me of the thick kind of indian pappad) - the chive dip was really good

seating is almost all bar-style and the staff was all friendly. i enjoyed it even though i don‚Äôt eat any seafood so if you‚Äôre on the fence, go

latte was delicious - strong and pleasantly sweet with the local honey. the breakfast burrito was also great (comes with i think a homemade hot sauce). overall, a must try if you‚Äôre headed to manoa falls - it is small and popular so order online beforehand

v nice and posh vibes. portion sizes are small and presentation was great - to be expected from a place like this. chicken dishes were good but the paneer dish tasted like soap. my fav dish here was the naan, super unique and would go back just for that

it‚Äôs a 4.5 but bumping to a 5 because of the pistachio ravioli. this was prob the most unique pasta dish i‚Äôve had. it had a decadent pistachio-based filling, a slightly tangy lemon sauce, and some crunchy breadcrumbs or more pistachios on top. it kind of tasted like a savory baklava in the form of a pasta

dips were pretty solid as well (came with fresh bread and pita), other pasta dish was mid. and ambiance was upscale casual

came here off a friend‚Äôs recommendation, will be unfriending her

i should have known as soon as i took a bite of my stale pappad that this was not the place to be. plus the tamarind and green sauces were so so watered down

the paneer makhani tasted straight up like tomato paste - they def didn't cook it for as long as they needed to and they didn't add enough cream. naan was decent and malai kofta was okay. i also got the chicken momos off the rec of our waiter - they were just okay

so many other decent indian places in nova
shredded chicken and spicy chicken were the best of the ones i had. prob the best empanadas i‚Äôve ever eaten
drinks are solid and vibes are nice - but the food is pretty mediocre. i prefer other places in the area, this one is just okay
good for takeout
went here after hiking in the area. i wasn‚Äôt expecting much but the food ended up being p solid, try the fries. outdoor aesthetic is really nice, would def come back when it‚Äôs a bit warmer

i ate a ton so obviously i felt p bloated after but this was a solid italian place (my fav cuisine). the pesto was a bit too salty but every other dish made up for it and then some. it‚Äôs located in rtc so great spot, would recommend a resy before you go
delicious sandwiches, ty for the rec @priyanka. went here twice when i visited - and i‚Äôd come back again. bottled matcha drinks were wack though

surprisingly good taste to price ratio here. wraps are pretty solid and although the falafel is a bit dry, there‚Äôs enough dressing and other stuff in the wrap to make it easy to eat. def a go to when i‚Äôm in the mall
went here for restaurant week. maybe it‚Äôs just because i don‚Äôt like french food that much but i wasn‚Äôt a huge fan. friends said oysters were solid. i did really like the desserts

upscale mexican spot by rick bayless. margs were potent, chips and salsa were good (esp green salsa), and both empanadas and quesadillas were solid (though slightly small portion sizes). i got the chicken tacos - flavors were delicious but the chicken + fajitas cooled down a bit by the time it got to our table üòï

overall would still recommend since the flavors and ambiance were awesome. creds to @tejas for the rec

the bread appetizer was underwhelming (but the seasoned oil was good), pizza was fine, would definitely recommend the pasta i had, and the tiramisu was good. service was great, too. good place for a nice, small group

just an okay thai place, can‚Äôt go wrong with panang curry. but i tried some other dishes like pad thai and the dumplings and it was pretty bad tbh. stick with the curry and takeout - and it‚Äôs alright

hands down the best bagel spot i know, and that‚Äôs not just bc of the nostalgia. all three spots in cville are basically the same

my go-to order is a no bull (veggie patty) on sesame with mayo, mustard, onion, and either the feta spread or provolone. if i‚Äôm really hungry i‚Äôll also get the cinnamon sugar spread on a plain bagel. the jalape√±o lime cream cheese is solid and so is the herb. this is always on the list of spots to visit when i‚Äôm back in cville. don‚Äôt let the line scare you, it always moves fast - they have the system down pat

very solid pizza spot with a variety of flavors, including some specialty indian ones (e.g. i got the paneer tikka). more than a few friends have told me that this is their fav pizza in the area - they have a few locations in arlington and dc. will come back to try out other their other kinds of pizza
this place has the best naan of all the indian places i‚Äôve been to in nova. overall solid indian food but nothing insanely special
better pizza hut pan pizza

make a resy before coming here - we got bar seating but still really enjoyed it. the place was super posh, great food and solid drinks. service was excellent. i‚Äôd recommend trying the truffle garlic bread

i know a few die hard wooboi fans but i‚Äôll say it: i think it‚Äôs kind of overrated, mainly bc the chicken can be really greasy. if you get over that then ya it‚Äôs alright, between a 3.5 and 4. they have an assortment of spice levels and the chicken is pretty thick
probably the best chicken sandwiches i‚Äôve had. heads up, the mac and cheese is pretty heavy and the tea is super sweet

so some dishes taste better the next day - when they‚Äôre not fresh. this can apply to really good pad thai and is the case here. if i rated thai treasure immediately after i went, i‚Äôd rate it a 3 but i had leftovers and it was really good. their spice tray includes really good chili oil and gave the dish a good mix of spicy and sweet. thai iced tea was also good. might go back to try their curries

stop by here if you‚Äôre in kensington market and thank me later. i really liked the boston cr√®me and the carrot cake donut was good, too. these are not super sweet which is exactly how i like my desserts

this place is a 3, possibly 3.5 bc of the dank pita bread and tzatziki. all other dishes were fine, borderline subpar. we got everything family style so tried a few - the spanakopita wasn‚Äôt that flavorful but it was ok, the kolokithokeftedes (the fritter balls) had too much dill for my taste, and i just didn‚Äôt really like the feta psiti. spreads were alright though - would recommend the tirokafteri (wasn‚Äôt really spicy but it was good). disclaimer though i‚Äôm not a huge fan of this kind of greek food overall, would prefer gyros instead but didn‚Äôt see any on the menu
the vibes are great. sangria is pretty good, food is just okay

i had the cairo kofta here and it was okay, just too salty for me. this is a plant-based restaurant so everything is vegan. some nice locals recommended it while they saw me eyeing the place. although i rated it a 3, i would come back to try some of the other items on the menu. the ‚Äúchicken‚Äù wrap looked good
strong 4, get pickled toppings as @ani mentioned. caramelized cheese crust is dank. pass on the mid garlic bread
drinks were solid, food was not bad. great vibes esp when it‚Äôs nice outside
super loud but solid vibes. only had drinks so can‚Äôt speak for the food

i was in the city for just a few hours and if you couldn‚Äôt have already guessed based on your feed, i made a resy here for 10 people and it basically ended up being a mini high school + college reunion for a few of us and meet-and-greet for some others. awesome company and vibes but that‚Äôs not the reason this place is a 5

i‚Äôve been to a huge number of indian places and baazi is comparable to some of the more posh places i‚Äôve been - think punjabi grill or celebration by rupa vira in dc

the must tries: the indian summer drink (basically spiked frooti), the kasoori methi chicken tikka app (this was amazing, easily the best chicken tikka i‚Äôve had for flavor, texture, and presentation), and either the chicken or paneer sirka pyaaz. both the garlic naan and rice were fresh

service was just okay (poor service is why google rated this sub-4). they messed up one of our orders and it was a little slow. but we had a large party so it‚Äôs excusable, especially since it was a small place and most other tables were filled. even with mediocre service, this place is a 5

it‚Äôs in upper west side so it‚Äôs probably going to be a hike but it‚Äôs well worth it. i‚Äôll come back at some point to try some of the other dishes. ty @gita for the original rec

still remains my favorite ramen place, better than daikaya in my books (though both are great in their own respects)

a note on spice levels: it‚Äôs on a 1 to 10 scale - but the waiter basically implied it‚Äôs really 1 to 5, and higher levels are considered really hot. got the 7 last time not knowing this and couldn‚Äôt finish it, got the 5 this time and it was better. but i‚Äôll likely get a 4 next time

got mine without the bamboo shoots and with a seasoned egg - the egg is a must have, it is so delicious
hot and honey chicken sandwich was super flavorful (and crispy) - but man was it greasy. if you‚Äôre into that, my brother claimed this to be one of the best chicken sandwiches he‚Äôs ever had
food was good, the burrito was massive and the tres leches cake was awesome. the service was great and the vibes were excellent (right on the waterfront). great place to stop by for food on front st
this is the bare minimum a mexican restaurant can do. food was kind of bland, portions were small, and service wasn‚Äôt great
i got the chaat and the pulao. chaat was nothing special and the pulao was just okay, didn't have as much flavor as i would have hoped. friendly people but food is eh
best iced matcha latte i‚Äôve had. clean aesthetic, too. low key i‚Äôd rather come here than chateau

pretty much on par with famous toastery imo. it‚Äôs not the best brunch food i‚Äôve had but it‚Äôs not awful either

i wanted something savory and something sweet. i had the tacos based off the waiters rec - they were decent (though i was pretty hungry). for something sweet, we split this lemon cream pancake dish - the cream was super sweet and the pancakes were dry. i had a bite of my friend‚Äôs ‚Äúchickichanga‚Äù and i liked it. also had some french toast but that was also mid
solid spot, the pizza comes with some awesome hot honey. just stick with getting the pizza, not the pasta or other dishes
they have a few locations and i went to the other one a few times when i was in seattle last. solid bagel sandwiches

solid, arguably best, kbbq spot in nova - though i haven't been to too many. as with every all-you-can-eat buffet, the more you eat the less you enjoy it. so if you have enough self control, unlike @vamsi and me, you'll prob thoroughly enjoy this spot: masala honey butter chicken was amazing, soy garlic chicken and spicy chicken were good. i‚Äôd recommend getting the dumplings on the side, too (they‚Äôre vegetarian). the potato salad and the pickled jalape√±os were good

down-ranking to a 4 bc of the mediocre service, the watered-down yum yum sauce, and the fact that the sides came out cold. also the mozz fondue was just a tin foil bowl of cheese, idk what that was about

the triple berry cream cheese literally tasted like cheesecake - and had actual berries to bite into. i‚Äôm not a fanatic for dessert bagels but this was really good. the sesame with veggie was also solid. they have a large collection of homemade spreads so i‚Äôll be back
noodles were decent, chicken was a bit dry but not bad

this is admittedly a harsh review. i thought it was a 3 when i went but found myself describing it as ‚Äúbad‚Äù to a friend later that night so here we are at a 2. spice 6 is basically a chipotle for indian food like naan pizza and naan wraps

the food was mediocre at best but the naan wrap i had was pretty subpar. unlike the pizza, they don‚Äôt cook it again after it comes out of the oven so the garlic remains too raw. flavors inside were mediocre and i couldn‚Äôt finish the wrap bc the naan was too dry (i just ate the insides). chaats were also not great - in retrospect they were lacking chutneys and raita for flavor. mango lassi was fine, but nothing to write home about. service was great though

@ani and @parth kindly insisted that i try some of their naan pizza and i‚Äôll admit it was better than the wrap but it doesn‚Äôt take it to a 3 for me given i wouldn‚Äôt come back for it

choolah is better if you‚Äôre looking for fast casual indian food

Place: Courthaus Social: An American Beer Garden

Review: quick and delicious cheesecake plus friendly staff. great pit stop at pike place market
must try, esp cheese flatbread. ambiance was solid and service was great. the turkish coffee wasn‚Äôt made in sand though

went here bc varun tasted it and gave it high accolades. it was pretty solid. service was a bit slow but they were really friendly/jovial. i don‚Äôt really like pesto pasta too much but was blown away by it here - cooked al dente and the sauce was creamy and subtle. and the tiramisu was prob the best tiramisu i‚Äôve had - not too sweet and not too bitter. downranked to a 4 bc of the mediocre apps and v subpar bread
lots of other better options around the area. plus the service wasn‚Äôt great

i was really looking forward to el fresco, the other reviews really made it seem dope. the nachos were really good (got it with veggie fajitas), the burrito was just mid (thumb for size reference). they have a salsa bar, the hot green salsa was solid. honestly was debating between a 3 and 4 bc the entree was just okay but the other dishes made up for it

would still go back to try some of their other dishes, they have a huge menu. place is pretty clean, i think it‚Äôs relatively new
great vibes for small groups but the food is mediocre at best
good food but better for takeout due to subpar vibes of restaurant

the 1.8k people who rated this 4.7 stars in google don‚Äôt have calibrated taste buds

chili garlic naan was just costco naan with those chili flakes you get at pizza places (see pic). butter chicken was as watery as the niagara falls (pic), and neither the gravy nor the chicken had much flavor. saag paneer was bad but better than the butter chicken. the royal falooda was meh, tbh felt like they accidentally put too much rose concentrate. i don‚Äôt intend to be so harsh but with the slow service and my admittedly high expectations, the only good thing i have to say about this place is that the music was decent
decent ramen, i like that they stir fry the veggies before they put them in the ramen. would recommend the veggie spice bomb (otherwise it‚Äôs a bit bland)
the burrito was definitely microwaved, i don‚Äôt know what google maps is talking about. nice people though

Place: The Board Room Game Bar & Brewery

Review: i got a breakfast burrito and i was so sad. it had the biggest chunks of potato that weren‚Äôt crispy or flavorful - and they still had the skin (though i know some people like that ü§¢). due to said chunks, there wasn‚Äôt much of the other fillings - double L. the only reason this is a 3 though is bc their pancakes (and i‚Äôve heard other sweet dishes) were really good. stick with the sweet dishes and this is a nice brunch spot

plant based hot dog is insane - moist bun, delicious condiments (including pickled chillies). i‚Äôd come back every time. if i didn‚Äôt have a dinner resy i‚Äôd order another one

chocolate cake shake was decent but nothing super special

another solid experience at celebration, i have pictures this time

pani puri with passion fruit pani was unique and flavorful. lotus root stem chaat was really good. and the black currant dahi puri was very interesting - insides had a strong kick and the yogurt mousse was pleasantly sweet, was not expecting the contrast but it was good

mai malai hu is a must if they have it (seasonal) - the red pepper sauce almost felt like a mix of italian and indian flavors, my favorite cuisines. chicken purana is okay, but it was a bit too oily compared to the other dishes. murg makhni was great. the sabzi mandi tasted truly
homemade - it was great if you like peanut-y/sesame-kind gravy. naans were fresh. pass on the chicken hot and sour soup - the fried noodles were a bit stale and the soup flavor was just medicore imo

holi rasmalai came with three flavors - paan and rose were the best (i'd get it again just for these), black currant was just ok. the chocolate explosion cake had jalebi, chocolate syrup, and ice cream - also good but super heavy

a few downsides: slightly stale puri and fried noodles for the soup, the curries were a little oily this time around, and the price-to-quantity ratio is higher than other indian restaurants

but celebration does an amazing job in presentation and the some of the dishes are really unique. def worth a try if you haven't been

my go-to dessert spot at rtc. always great vibes here, esp summer evenings with good company. i typically get the affogato with a subtle gelato flavor like fior di latte but i‚Äôve had most of the  flavors and they‚Äôre all great. friends sometimes get the sorbets and they‚Äôre good as well. i typically like desserts that aren‚Äôt extremely sweet and this place delivers

decent place for cocktails on the less popular side of mosaic. we got outdoor seating so i didn't get a chance to go inside, but it seemed like it had great vibes. drinks overall were good. i got the love street based on the rec from the staff and it's the first gin drink i actually liked - it‚Äôs the one at the bottom of the pic. they also recommended no church in the wild and pursuit of happiness. our waiter was friendly and attentive

great company (@priyanka @parth @ani) and great vibes on a nice summer night, ended up staying way longer than expected
honestly not sure why this is rated so well. it‚Äôs alright, and portions sizes are way too small
hot take, this place is overhyped. their bagels are too hard

i got the veggie ramen and it was p trash. ask for the spicy oil and chillies so it doesn‚Äôt just taste like stale broth. they have no chicken broths (or chicken for that matter). my friend had the tonkatsu and said it was alright

@priyanka‚Äôs review reminded me of choongman. great place and beats bonchon for korean fried chicken imo. super crispy and flavorful chicken but can be excessively greasy depending on what you get. they‚Äôre known for their tikkudak chicken - which means the chicken is fried then baked apparently giving it that nice crisp
probably my fav chicken taco place. don‚Äôt get the cactus tacos though

i wasn‚Äôt even that hungry but we drove out of the way to come here‚Ä¶as we did multiple times before. this is hands down the best kabob place i‚Äôve been to and i challenge someone to find a place better. you can literally see them making the kabobs fresh for each order and they‚Äôre delicious. the side sauce is really good (esp the white dill one), the naan melts in your mouth, and the staff is really friendly

@vamsi so graciously brought me back some since he was in the area for an errand, a true friend. i‚Äôve had duck donuts here, in cville, and in the original location and they‚Äôre all basically the same. great, cake-based donuts that are made fresh and so good when warm. my go to donuts are s‚Äômores and cookies + cream. def can see how they all can meld in taste, esp similar flavors, but i still like them both for the taste and texture. plus they bring back nice memories

it‚Äôs pretty good - the fried eggplant sticks weren‚Äôt really crispy but they tasted good and the szechuan chicken was good. this is my friend‚Äôs fav chinese place in the area, i want to go back and try some of their other dishes
decent food, the tofu dishes are better than the chicken dishes. they have an interesting cocktail selection during the summer

nice and classy place but i think it gets too much credit. the food is a hit or miss. biscuits were good (clearly fresh) but just a tad dry. cornbread def wasn‚Äôt cooked all the way through. the butternut squash mascarpone ravioli was just ok. tried a few bites of the fried chicken with mac and cheese - chicken was kind of oily. i‚Äôm rating it a 3 bc of the aesthetic and i‚Äôve heard the brunch buffet is solid. but food is just okay at best

forgot to take a pic of the biscuits before we started eating so ignore the bites taken out already
an extremely ratchet, cash-only bar where drinks are served in ketchup bottles. obviously there are much nicer places in admo but nothing compares to the degenerate vibes of this place

downgrading to a 4, rated it a 5 earlier bc i hadn‚Äôt had it in so long. still a great place for chicken (as always half soy garlic, half spicy strips with a side of rice). but it‚Äôs pretty heavy and the meat can be stringy at times. still think choong man is slightly better for solid korean style chicken
nothing really special here except for of course the pizookie and possibly the deep dish. service was pretty subpar
solid thai food
it was pretty good but there are tons of other options in admo so hard to compare

Place: Sisters Thai The Ordinary Caf√© (at MOSAIC)
Review:
i‚Äôve been here several times and although it‚Äôs not as great as it used to be, it‚Äôs solid thai food. i got the panang curry as always - a bit salty and watery but still good. had some of my friend‚Äôs pad thai and it was great, will prob get the pad thai next time

don‚Äôt get the tofu app, it was such a let down. they have thai beer (as expected) and i got their honeysuckle cocktail - a bit sweet but it was alright

we had great service and the ambiance of the place was posh. would recommend trying the chicken chilaquiles (egg chilaquiles is not the move). i liked the mushroom quesadilla but the tortilla is a unique and dry - i can see it being either a hit or miss for different people. margs were alright. and i would very highly recommend the churros + dulce de leche, very obviously fresh, so flakey, and not at all too sweet. def on the more expensive side, we spent about 80 bucks a person

for a vegan place, this wasn‚Äôt bad. vegan chicken is hard to pull off but this is probably the best i‚Äôve had (but would prefer the real deal any day). worth a visit as its close to chinatown so there‚Äôs lots of other places to stop by after getting some nuggets here

punjabi-owned indian spot in brampton, so so good. interior was kind of wack but we went bc the reviews were solid. saw a lot of locals coming in for pick up which was a great sign

tandoori paneer was dank flavor-wise, the paneer itself was a bit soft but still good. chole bhature was great, so soft and puffy. the raita that came with it was adequately flavored, not liquid-y, and had boondi for some crunch - it was so good. paneer makani was a bit more watery than i would have liked but it was delicious nonetheless. the naan is what took this place to the next level - i tried the garlic, plain, and chili naan. they were slightly discolored because of how much butter but that's what made it so delicious. they added black sesame seeds, too, which was a nice touch. the meal came with onions (as you'd get at virtually every other indian place) but also these pickled carrots which were good

this is easily some of the unhealthiest indian food i've had, glad i don't live in brampton
this is my favorite kabob place in nova. tons of food and super filling. i esp like their dill green yogurt sauce and melt in your mouth naan

it was raining all day when we went and this place hit the spot both for the pub-y vibes and the delicious food + drinks. they have a rotating specials menu, i got the chicken cheesesteak and it was awesome: chicken was charred and peppers + onions weren‚Äôt overpowering. this is mainly why i‚Äôm rating this a 5. wings app was good and my friend said that this place has the best nachos he‚Äôs ever tried

we headed over to the bar since they had a solid drink selection and ended up staying until close to close. service was great (except one person but our bartender apologized on her behalf lol)
pretty unique place - everything is vegan. food was pretty solid, would recommend going w a nice group and having everything family style. the hot and sour soup was particularly satisfying

thought this place was going to deliver on indian curry style pizza due to high ratings - boy did it not. this pizza is literally just normal pizza with a few paneer cubes on it, not much flavor at all

french fry chaat was an interesting idea but it was executed poorly - cold and so watery. naan was dry and certainly not fresh. curry flavors were okay but they gave three kofta balls with just enough sauce for four ants

at least its location is nice, it‚Äôs in georgetown

this is a really well-rated thai place - 4.6 on google maps with 9.4k reviews, 4.5 on yelp with 3k reviews. and man does it deliver

probably some of the best chicken pad thai i‚Äôve had, on par and arguably better than what i‚Äôve had in thailand. it mainly stood out bc of the char on the chicken - it made for a smokey aroma and resulted in delicious flavors throughout the entire dish. the ingredients seemed fresh, and they were thoroughly cooked and meshed really well together - sometimes it‚Äôs easy to pick out different flavors in different bites of pad thai, not the case here

would recommend booking in advance. we got takeout bc we got there p late and the wait was too long. i really want to come back and try some of the curry dishes (which i would have ordered if i was dining in)

i was craving italian so we came here. aesthetic inside was posh and food was solid. took our waitress‚Äôs rec on the gnocchi and it didn‚Äôt disappoint, just get the red pepper flakes on the side. the pizza was a slight miss - they didn‚Äôt char the bottom enough but it wasn‚Äôt bad since the cheese and sauce were certainly fresh. their sourdough bread was also really solid. overall great place, would recommend
these are portuguese donuts. they‚Äôre made fresh and the place was a great pit stop on the way back to waikiki from pearl harbor. the mocha wasn‚Äôt anything special though

heavy (thick) but good cookies, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. prefer the chocolate chip walnut and i‚Äôm not usually one to like nuts in my cookies. you need to have these with cold milk. leftovers aren‚Äôt bad once warmed up
the breakfast sandwich was so good, the croissant was flakey and the omelette had such a delicious cream cheese + chive filling

really glad we stumbled upon this place. i asked for chicken recommendations and the nice staff suggested either the chicken spicy miso ramen or the umai curry ramen. ended up getting the latter which is just khao soi. i was pleasantly surprised - the curry broth was packed with flavor, the meat was really tender, and they did not skimp on the crispy noodles. the flavors all meshed nicely - i‚Äôve tried khao soi at lots of other places and it‚Äôs rarely as cohesive as this dish was

chicken karaage was bomb, too. not only was it nice and crispy, the chicken itself has almost a masala flavor. the karaage was delicious when coupled with the chilli oil. i also got the iced matcha milk tea - that was decent but don‚Äôt get the bubbles, they had a weird texture

overall solid spot and would def go back. great music, too, and cozy/homey vibes. i‚Äôm told the tonkatsu was fire. this is realistically a 4.5 but i tried my friends‚Äô spicy chicken and vegan miso broths and wasn‚Äôt a fan. but i was happy with my curry which is what this place seems to be known for

i was debating between a 1 and 2. mango lassi and samosa were good, everything else was abysmal - no flavor whatsoever, this is ‚Äúindian‚Äù food for non-indian people. outdoor evening/night vibes were okay
got take out, it was alright - really a 3.5. got chicken soup dumplings and fried dumplings and tried some kung pao and sweet and sour chicken. worth a stop if you like dumplings but nothing fancy

adyar ananda bhavan is generally reputed make some of the most authentic south indian food but alas it was not great

got the paneer chilly fried off @shrinath rec - solid texture and decent flavor but was missing spice. mini tiffin upma was good, its plain dosa was solid, but the pongal came out cold. sambar was flavorful but chutneys were a slight miss, not enough spice

chole bhatura was too oily. rava dosa took about 6 years to come out but it was actually decent if you‚Äôre ok with the oil (that‚Äôs kinda how it has to be)

super chaotic inside, too - very mid place, arguably slightly subpar
they‚Äôre known for their indian speciality pizza. my friends and i get this often for game nights, always solid

this is a mexican/indian fusion. pretty unique concept and the food was solid (though i didn‚Äôt like the leftovers for some reason). would recommend nachos and soup, entree was good as well. my friends say the veggie stuff here is solid
ani overhyped this place. this is good pizza but it‚Äôs just that, nothing crazy. i had the eggplant and added some hot honey. wouldn‚Äôt mind going back to try others

such a solid india place, compares to posh indian restaurants in dc like rasika. presentation was great and food was solid. would recommend the unique gol gappa (never had cranberry juice in the pani) and the desserts

overhyped burrito joint. not very flavorful, especially the rice. make sure you add some of the sauce they have out. it‚Äôs in dupont so the location isn‚Äôt bad. might come back though to try their tacos

excellent taste and solid spice options (1 to 10), probably the best ramen i‚Äôve had so far. would highly recommend adding the seasoned egg. i got the 7 spice level and it was way too hot for me tbh but overall, this was surprisingly good for veggie ramen
pretty oily dishes but if you‚Äôre craving chinese, it gets the job done
i think this place is only bit overhyped (and slightly gone down in quality) but it‚Äôs solid. it‚Äôs probably one of the better thai places in the area. the place is a bit small but it‚Äôs cozy

this place looked so good and i was looking forward to it but it‚Äôs not the move

bread was def not fresh, it was dry and super hard - which make it so difficult to eat. had to ask them for extra sauce and i still couldn‚Äôt finish it. flavors tbh sound better than they really are

lots of other places at the wharf, this is not it
def worth a try at mosaic, flavored batter mini pancake balls (or waffles) with toppings/sauce. we got oreo batter with chocolate sauce and it was pretty good

came to tysons and found this new spot - i asked them and they just opened three weeks ago. i got the roasted dandelion iced latte and it was good. it was surprisingly tea-based but tasted like coffee. plus, the people were really friendly. would come back to try some of their other flavors

got coffee with a few friends here this morning. great location and a decent bit of outdoor seating for when the weather is nice (like today)

it was relatively busy which is always a good sign. saw some people get actual brunch here, too - might come back to try at some point

first time having mochi donuts, they were so chewy and good. churro and lavender flavors were my fav, wish they were warmer though. also got the hot cheetos + mozz hot dog (all veggie) which was good if you drizzle the condiments (but also a little heavy). super friendly staff, too

lost a star bc there was a piece of plastic in my dish, what. this would be an automatic 1 or 2 but i was hungry and food still tasted good. service was v nice
